# TrackOpticalFlowRequest

**Class**

A request that determines the direction change of vectors for each pixel from a previous to current image.

## Declaration

```swift
final class TrackOpticalFlowRequest
```

## Overview

This request generates an [doc://Vision/documentation/Vision/OpticalFlowObservation] object that describes the directional change from image to image. The request works at the pixel level, so both images needs to have the same dimensions to successfully perform the request.



## Creating a request

- **init(_:frameAnalysisSpacing:)**: Creates an optical-flow tracking request.

## Getting the revision

- **revision**: The algorithm or implementation the request uses.
- **supportedRevisions**: The collection of revisions the request supports.
- **TrackOpticalFlowRequest.Revision**: A type that describes the algorithm or implementation that the request performs.

## Inspecting a request

- **computationAccuracy**: The level of accuracy to compute the optical flow.
- **TrackOpticalFlowRequest.ComputationAccuracy**: A type that describes the computational accuracy.
- **outputPixelFormatType**: The desired pixel format type of the observation.
- **supportedOutputPixelFormatTypes**: The collection of supported pixel format types.

## Performing a request

- **perform(on:orientation:)**: Performs the request on an image URL and produces observations.
- **perform(on:orientation:)**: Performs the request on image data and produces observations.
- **perform(on:orientation:)**: Performs the request on a Core Graphics image and produces observations.
- **perform(on:orientation:)**: Performs the request on a pixel buffer and produces observations.
- **perform(on:orientation:)**: Performs the request on a Core Media buffer and produces observations.
- **perform(on:orientation:)**: Performs the request on a Core Image image and produces observations.
- **OpticalFlowObservation**: An object that represents an optical flow that an image-analysis request produces.

## Optical flow and rectangle detection
